kn.uni.inf.sensortagvr.stor

Class StorageMainService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • kn.uni.inf.sensortagvr.stor.StorageMainService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class StorageMainService
extends android.app.Service
    Main Service that should get started with the App. It registers a broadcastReceiver for Sensor Data.

    Created by Gero on 16.05.17.

      • makeGattUpdateIntentFilter

        private static android.content.IntentFilter makeGattUpdateIntentFilter()

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        On Creating the service, the broadcast receiver will registered with an proper intent filter The TrackingManagerService gets bound to this service, thus the getCurrentLocation() can be accessed.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Service

        public android.os.IBinder onBind(android.content.Intent intent)
        The service is bound by the RecordDataActivity for creating a measurement session.

        onRebind in class android.app.Service

      • createNewSession

        public void createNewSession()
        This method is essential to work with the StorageMainService. This Method registers a receiver to get data from the sensor and initializes a new ArrayList.

      • continueSession

        public void continueSession()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This method tries to read the current JSON-file and create a ArrayList from it. If there isn't any JSON-file a new session will be created.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • measureData

        public void measureData()
        Collects all data received by the ble-service and the loc-service, and saves them into the ArrayList measured

      • save

        public void save()
        Scales the data down (if necessary) and writes it to a JSON-file.

      • closeMeasureSession

        public void closeMeasureSession()

      • writeInJsonFile

        private void writeInJsonFile(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given List to a data.json file using the gson-library. If a file already exists, it gets overwritten. Only one session can be saved this way. This may be extended in the future.
        Parameters:
        list - List to be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • scaleData

        private void scaleData(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        This method scales all data values in a list thus the minimum data value is -1.5 and the maximum data value is -.5
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList with CompactData

      • scaleLocation

        private void scaleLocation(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        This method scales all location values in a list thus the minimum location value is .5 and the maximum location value is 29.5 for the x-values and 49.5 for the y values.
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList with CompactData

      • calculateMinDataVal

        private double calculateMinDataVal(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        Calculates the smallest data-Value in a ArrayList of CompactData and returns it.
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of CompactData
        Returns:
        smallest data-Value found as double

      • calculateMaxDataVal

        private double calculateMaxDataVal(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        Calculates the biggest data-Value in a ArrayList of CompactData and returns it.
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of CompactData
        Returns:
        biggest data-Value found as double

      • calculateMaxDistance

        private double[] calculateMaxDistance(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        Determines the biggest distance a point has to the nullpoint.

        If distortion is active, the fi

        Parameters:
        list - ist of location points
        Returns:
        If distortion is active, the first value of the array is the biggest distance a point has on the x-axis and the second value is the biggest distance a point has on the y-axis. If distortion is not active, the first value is the biggest distance a point has to any axis. (the second value will be like with distortion active)

      • calculateMinValues

        private double[] calculateMinValues(java.util.ArrayList<CompactData> list)
        Calculates the smallest X and the smallest Y value in a ArrayList of CompactData. The smallest X value and the smallest Y value may come from different CompactData-Objects.
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of CompactData
        Returns:
        the smallest X and the smallest Y value as an double array, in which the first item is the X value.

      • uploadFile

        public void uploadFile()
        Uploads the File using Uploader. Note that this method will not save the current Data in the File, so be sure to call save() before you call this method.
